author: legozander
title: great matoran :)
review: I got Garan a Toymaster shop and built him in the car and he is a great matoran. he is very handy for parts. He includes three black bohrok feet       two very very rare weapons a Whenua mask and  other very handy parts for bionicle colecters.Overall garan is worth getting. His play abiity is high plus his parts are very handy.So Garan definitly  a  set worth getting

author: arc_trooper
title: cool matoran
review: I saw Garan at a walgreen store and I buyed him.After I was finished building Garan he looked cool and I think he is better than the 2008 matorans.He might be short,but he's fun to play with especially when you have the toa inika and the piraka.I will give the little guy a 4/5

author: Gus_263
title: Small but also cool onu matoran
review: Garan is one of the most small matoran ever created, but is also playable. Like all the 2006 matoran he features an different form of building. This set includes the mask Ruru and two blades, easy to play. His head, legs and arms are playable more than the other matoran of 2006 due to the form of build. Garan do not have much pieces and is very small but is in overall, very good. I rate this set 5/5

author: DarthVader_
title: Cool Onu-Matoran!
review: This is a really cool matoran!  I like his weapons, his mask, and everything else!  he is one of my favorte matoran!  I like how it is put together!  It is a really cool set, and I hope they make more sets like him, and improve it!

author: I_like_Lego
title: good small little guy
review:
I got this little guy for my birthday along with Avak,he is small just how i like them,and his arms are nice,and he has a great mask,and nice black feet.

Pros:)
.Nice mask
.Nice black feet
.Small
.I like how his hands are done 
.I like his weapons 
.Grey spikes
.I like his weapons
.I like his small little body

Cons:(
.Has no eyes
Overall 9/10,it sure matters if he has eyes.

author: vexorian
title: Nice for parts
review:
If you can get it for 3 or less USD and you are into building bionicle MOCs stuff then it is in my opinion a good deal to buy these voya-matoran. At least for Garan I was happy to see the parts:

To sum up:
* 3 rahaga/bohrok feet.
* 2 SILVER bohrok teeth! This is hard to notice in pics and it seems all the voya-matoran come with bohrok teeth in a rare color.
* 2 silver weapons, ok that's a little generic but these specific ones are sort of cool. 
* Useful articulation parts.
* The mask is not half bad.

Be warned that unlike what some promotional pics and the box may suggest, he does not come with semi-transparent eyes for the head.

I really just bought him for the parts. However, he is so small without looking lame that I think that if you got the collection of these guys you could use them to decorate a small shelf. 

They also have a combiner, some sort of spider thing that seems to be nice. (I like the fact they managed to have a symmetrical combiner for once)

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO BIONICLE (Matoran) - Garan Review
review:
This is a fun little figure to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Box/Instructions

The instruction has only 2 pages and there're no mistakes in it.

Parts

This figure has some nice parts: We get two weapons, two nice looking feet and another mask which we've seen on Toa Metru Whenua. All pieces are great for future MOC's (My own creations) and/or brickfilms for sure.

The build

The build is very nice and easy and we don't have to complain about stickers as well.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/8724-1.jpg[/img]


The arms, the hands, the legs, the feet and the head can be swiveled. I think the design of this figure is really simple and cool - even if it is a small set and even if it doesn't have a lot of play features. As I told you in the beginning: This is a fun little set to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Summary

All in all this set is an great set and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion
Review

author: jonathanfrye1999
title: Garan, My first Bionicle
review:
Hello! I'm jonathanfrye1999, and today I will be reviewing set 8724, Garan. This was my first ever Bionicle set, and in my opinion, one of the greatest Matoran sets ever released by Lego.

Box/Instructions 

Garan was packaged in a small cardboard box with an image displaying him in an action pose on the front. The instructions were printed on a single folded sheet, but also included part of instructions for a combi model including him and two other Matoran from the series.

Parts

No new molds. Interesting pieces include the blades and Whenua Metru's mask. 

Minifigures

None

The build

The build was quite interesting and unique for a Matoran. The Bohrok foot utilized as the body core makes for an interesting building technique, and how the hip sockets and Bohrok eyes contribute to the shape of the body intrigues me.

The completed model

Garan is a small figure, measuring about 4" high. He is disproportionate with big feet, a big head and a small body, but he is highly articulate, with 9 points of articulation, and can hit many awesome poses. A minor con is that his arms connect to his shoulders at an awkward angle, but this is easily fixed.

Overall opinion

Overall, I love this little guy. The building technique I learned (putting a Bohrok foot in the center of the body and using the exposed joint as the head's socket) has proved useful in dozens of Matoran mocs, and his parts are useful for mocing. I highly recommend this set. If you find this set for a good price on EBay, don't hesitate on picking it up.
